title: Ticket #4283: Improve synchronization of the job log.
description:
For updates, there's no reason to use fsync (which sync's data and metadata) on the job_queue.log; only fdatasync (which only sync's data) is really needed.

The metadata probably only needs to be synchronized on rotation...

...speaking of which, our current code for job_queue.log rotation is not safe. We use rename() to rotate the file; there's no guarantee which copy of the data is in which file after a crash. To make sure the rename persists, we need to call fsync on the directory to make sure the directory metadata is on disk.
remarks:
2014-Apr-01 08:40:57 by bbockelm:
I have an implementation of this prepared in branch V8_1-gt4283 - just trying to get the conditional compilation magic happy across all platforms, including those without fdatasync.

Investigation with 'strace' indicates that, with the patch, we are doing the rename according to POSIX and have replaced fsync with fdatasync for classad log updates.

Additionally, I updated the LinuxTuning page to reflect the knowledge about fsync and ext{3,4} mount options.

2014-Jul-08 13:37:53 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Nice patch!! Some things to change:

  1. When fsync of the parent directory meta-data on rename() fails, the code should EXCEPT, just like it excepts if it fails to sync the contents of the file.
  2. Should not need to explicitly include unistd.h in files that already include condor_common.h - condor_common.h already includes system header files
  3. Should use CMAKE to test for and flag the existence of fdatasync() instead of relying on unistd posix flags, just for consistency
  4. Should add a version history blurb (no need for additional documentation beyond that)

Once the above are fixed, please merge into master, as the parts using fdatasync are really just a scalability improvement. While it is true the parts to sync the directory meta-data on rename is a bug fix, it is a rare enough race condition that I am good with it going just into master.
